page.title: 05DETAILS OF AREA -TEANASSIE
page.content: The deer farm includes the Breakachy Farm , below which the Breakachy Burn falls into a deep gorge 200-300 feet deep.From there onwards until it joins the River Beauly it is called the Teanassie Burn. On its west bank about 200 metres from the main Beauly-Cannich road stands Teanassie School and Schoolhouse. About 400 metres farther up the hill towards Breakachy Farm stands a derelict croft house called Teagate which means in Gaelic-Gate House.About 200 metres further on stands the croft house of Cruenassie and 300 metres further on still stands another croft house called Culour.On the north east side of the Teanassie Burn the deer farm extends from the main Beauly-Cannich road to the Kilmorack Reservior-an area of 20 hectares. Teanassie means house by the falls.
